[[Globalization]]

Globalisation and the Bible

Article - The Bible and Globalisation - [https://banneroftruth.org/us/resources/articles/2007/a-christian-perspective-on-globalisation/](https://banneroftruth.org/us/resources/articles/2007/a-christian-perspective-on-globalisation/)

Video - Faith and Globalisation - [Faith and Globalization](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5OLHAWfJ_8Y)

![](data:image/png;base64,)

 Notes:

in this seminar on faith and globalization we're interested in exploring how faith and globalization processes intersect with one another now faith remains to be a powerful force in the world today indeed the number of adherents to various world tradition religious traditions is growing today and not just growing but also various faith traditions are increasingly inserting themselves into public domain and then the question is how does faith as engaged for it intersect with globalization processes what is the nature first of the religious resurgence what is their extent of that resurgence and then how in particular faith is inserting them so that itself in globalization processes we want to look at particular cases from various spheres of life in which that becomes evident and we're interested in conditions under which faith can in a salutary way inserts itself and contribute to human flourishing so primary questions that we are engagement is can faith be part of globalization processes or must it by the very nature of the faith itself retreat in a ghetto and if it gets engaged in the world today in particular in globalization processes how can that engagement be constructive how can it be in such a way that it shapes to the good those powerful forces that globalization processes are and in particular I think significant issue is whether the faith which by its nature defines the identity of people and its adherents whether it can not just define and give meaning to the lives of people but also pull diverse people's together so that they can work in cooperative ways of course the course of this sort will be covering diverse topics and approaching it from he vantage point of different religions but it has limitations and we will limit ourselves to three religions Christianity Islam and Buddhism and maybe making side looks at other religions as well and also we cannot survey the whole of the globe we will concentrate on North America Europe and Asia but this is only a first in the series of courses that will be offered t Yale of the same nature and in the fall of 2009 and 2010 we will repeat and this time hopefully broaden the scope include more topics include other religions which we have left unincluded as well as ask different sets of questions that emerge in the context of the intersection between faith and globalization processes

 Article - Globalisation and the Growing Church  [https://berkleycenter.georgetown.edu/essays/globalization-and-the-growing-church](https://berkleycenter.georgetown.edu/essays/globalization-and-the-growing-church)

 Article - The Jesuits and Globalisation [https://www.researchgate.net/publication/323774231_The_Jesuits_and_globalization_historical_legacies_and_contemporary_challenges](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/323774231_The_Jesuits_and_globalization_historical_legacies_and_contemporary_challenges)

Consider the information discussed in the resource above. Provide a brief summary of it and describe something interesting that you have discovered.

In summary, globalisation has allowed the spread of religion all across the world, ever since the sixteenth century. What I found interesting is how interconnected out consciousness is.
